strategy: Replace the deep neural network with a Gradient Boosting Machine (e.g., LightGBM or XGBoost) using targeted feature interactions. Instead of relying on one-hot encodings, introduce polynomial feature engineering for key numerical variables (e.g., area × rooms, age²) and apply target encoding for categorical variables with low cardinality. Use a learning rate of 0.01 and 1000 boosting rounds with early stopping based on validation R². This approach leverages tree-based models' strong performance on structured data with robust feature interaction capabilities, while avoiding the high-dimensional pitfalls of one-hot encoding.
